column4: If you don't have Windows on the machine already, you can't add it after Ubuntu, other than as in a Virtual Machine. Windows wipes everything on the drive.
True as vise says, but you will lose GRUB, and need to use a live CD to repair it later. Plenty of threads for that at ubuntuforums.org
You need access to the data from a Windows OS? Is the Ubuntu partition ext3? Or FAT?
GRUB is a boot loader. If you have more than one OS, it's what lets you choose which one to use.
